METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Redovne skupnosti kot element povezanosti med slovenskim in širšim evropskim prostorom
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Religious Orders as Cohesive Elements between Slovenia and Europe
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Kolar, Bogdan
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: Različnost redovnih skupnosti in njihova povezanost na mednarodni ravni je pomembna značilnost Katoliške Cerkve. Že od antike dalje so redovne skupnosti navzoče v slovenskem prostoru, večina njih ima svoje začetke v drugih okoljih; Šele v 19. in 20. stoletju so bile nekatere skupnosti ustanovljene na Slovenskem. Skupnosti so bile mednarodno sestavljene in tako tudi organizirane. V skladu z lastnimi pravili so v slovenski prostor prinašale kulturne dobrine, postavljale arhitekturne spomenike, posamezni člani so se uveljavili v evropskem prostoru kot teološki pisci. Prispevek predstavi evropski značaj redovnih skupnosti kot prednost, ki je bila v času totalitarnih državnih oblasti razumljena kot nevarna.

An important feature of the Catholic Church is thè variety of its monastic societies and their international ties. Religious orders have been present in the territory of present-day Slovenia since thè antiquity. Most of them had been founded elsewhere, and some of them did not come to Slovenia until the 19th and the 20th centuries. They were composed and organized on international level. According to their own régulation, church orders brought to this territory certain cultural elements; they also built architectural monuments. Some of their members became acclaimed theological authors recognized in other parts of Europe as well. Presented is the European character of ecclesiastical orders in Slovenia which during thè totalitarian regime was perceived as a dangerous element.
METS:xmlData.dcterms:subject: katoliška Cerkev
redovne skupnosti
posvetne ustanove
Catholic Church
religious orders
secular institutes

METS:xmlData.entity:description: Različnost redovnih skupnosti in njihova povezanost na mednarodni ravni je pomembna značilnost Katoliške Cerkve. Že od antike dalje so redovne skupnosti navzoče v slovenskem prostoru, večina njih ima svoje začetke v drugih okoljih; Šele v 19. in 20. stoletju so bile nekatere skupnosti ustanovljene na Slovenskem. Skupnosti so bile mednarodno sestavljene in tako tudi organizirane. V skladu z lastnimi pravili so v slovenski prostor prinašale kulturne dobrine, postavljale arhitekturne spomenike, posamezni člani so se uveljavili v evropskem prostoru kot teološki pisci. Prispevek predstavi evropski značaj redovnih skupnosti kot prednost, ki je bila v času totalitarnih državnih oblasti razumljena kot nevarna.

An important feature of the Catholic Church is thè variety of its monastic societies and their international ties. Religious orders have been present in the territory of present-day Slovenia since thè antiquity. Most of them had been founded elsewhere, and some of them did not come to Slovenia until the 19th and the 20th centuries. They were composed and organized on international level. According to their own régulation, church orders brought to this territory certain cultural elements; they also built architectural monuments. Some of their members became acclaimed theological authors recognized in other parts of Europe as well. Presented is the European character of ecclesiastical orders in Slovenia which during thè totalitarian regime was perceived as a dangerous element.
